physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady. She is seated on a chair and resting her arms on the supports. SheHe is is looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. Both her hands are placed on her lap. She is wearing her ethnic costume.
sgcool_label_text:
This studio portrait shows a seated nyonya in a baju panjang.

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
title_text: Studio portrait of a seated nyonya
subject_terms_1: studio portraits women (female humans) Peranakan folk costume
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Women Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people)
